Paper.definition: a piece of paper containing a written statement

1.definition: a piece of paper containing a written statement

sub_terms.a: a formal written composition or document often intended for publication [the Federalist]
sub_terms.b: a document containing a statement of legal status, identity, authority, or ownership often used in pl. whether applying to one or more items [naturalization] [this policy, including the endorsements and the attached""]
sub_terms.c: a document (as an answer, motion, or brief) prepared in furtherance of a legal action [allafter the complaint required to be served upon a party shall be filed with the court "Rule 5(d)"]

1.s: after the complaint required to be served upon a party shall be filed with the court "

2.definition: a document providing evidence of a financial obligationin this entry

accommodation paper.definition: commercial paper used by one party to accommodate another party

bearer paper.definition: commercial paper that is freely negotiable by the holder and is made payable to bearer comparein this entry

chattel paper.definition: paper that sets out both a buyer's obligation to repay and a lender's or a seller's security interest in the goods bought or that contains the provisions of a lease of the goods

commercial paper.definition: a usually negotiable instrument (as a note, draft, or certificate of deposit) arising out of a commercial transactionany of the instruments constituting the obligations of a business organization that are sold as investments

order paper.definition: commercial paper that is payable to order comparein this entry
